content: Who painted the iconic image of a pipe with the caption "Ceci n'est pas une pipe", which translates to "This is not a pipe"?

The iconic image you're referring to was painted by the Belgian surrealist artist René Magritte. The painting is titled "The Treachery of Images" (La trahison des images), and it was created in 1928-1929. The painting depicts a realistic portrayal of a pipe, accompanied by the caption "Ceci n'est pas une pipe," which indeed translates to "This is not a pipe." Magritte's intention was to challenge the viewer's perception and understanding of representation, highlighting the difference between an image and the real object it represents.
